entry.title: Trial of abducted Armenian servicemen begins in Azerbaijan

media:group.media:title: Trial of abducted Armenian servicemen begins in Azerbaijan
media:group.media:description:
๐The International Committee of the Red Cross evacuated 15 critically ill patients from Artsakh to Armenia. ๐Armenian Airlines launches direct flights between Yerevan and Istanbul. ๐The trial of two Armenian servicemen who were abducted by Baku earlier this year has begun. They face charges of illegally crossing the Armenia-Azerbaijan border. ๐Armen Grigoryan, the head of Armeniaโs Security Council, is traveling to Washington for meetings with high-level U.S. officials, days after the latest round of Armenia-Azerbaijan talks ended.

entry.title: โYoung Armenians need to see a future, in order to pursue a career in the sciencesโ

media:group.media:title: โYoung Armenians need to see a future, in order to pursue a career in the sciencesโ
media:group.media:description:
Vahe Petrosian is a professor of physics and applied physics at Stanford University. He is in Armenia to attend the Armenian Society of Fellows conference which works to advance higher education and research in the country. Professor Petrosian discusses why youth interest is so important for a strong science sector, as well as why clear career paths must be available in order for young Armenians to pursue a career in the sector. He also speaks about the growing presence of Armenians in science faculties, research centers and institutions around the world.

entry.title: Water outages and gas deficits are the new normal in Gishi, Artsakh

media:group.media:title: Water outages and gas deficits are the new normal in Gishi, Artsakh
media:group.media:description:
The population of Artsakh has been subjected to a blockade for over half a year now. Azerbaijan's closure of the Lachin corridor has left the region without access to Armenia or to the rest of the world. During this time, CivilNet continues to visit different villages in Artsakh to understand first-hand how the people have been impacted by the blockade.
This time, we are in Gishi Village in Artsahkhโs Martuni Region to talk to residents about the direct effect that the blockade has had on them.

ีีธึีถีซีฝีซ 13-ีซีถ ึ 15-ีซีถ ีฟีฅีฒีกึีกีฎ ีฐีธึีคีกีผีกีฟ ีกีถีฑึึีถีฅึีซ ึ ีฏีกึีฏีธึีฟีซ ีฐีฅีฟึีกีถึีธีพ ีดีฅีฎ ีพีถีกีฝีถีฅึ ีง ีฏึีฅีฌ ีีซีฝีซีกีถ ีฐีกีดีกีตีถึีซ ิดีกึีขีกีฝ ีขีถีกีฏีกีพีกีตึีจึ ีีธึึีป ีฅึีฏีธึ ีชีกีด ีฟึีกีฎ ีฐีธึีคีกีผีกีฟ ีกีถีฑึึีซึ ีพีถีกีฝีพีฅีฌ ีฅีถ ีดึีฃีกีฟีธึ ีฎีกีผีฅึีจ, ีขีกีถีปีกึีกีถีกีขีธีฝีฟีกีถีกีตีซีถ ีฏีธึีฌีฟีธึึีกีถีฅึีจ ึ ีคีกีทีฟีฅึีจ: ิฝีกึีกีถีพีฅีฌ ีฅีถ ีกึึีกีตีซีถ ีปึีกีฟีกึีกึีธึึีซีนีถีฅึีจ, ีซีฝีฏ ีฐีฅีฒีฅีฒีจ ึีทีฅีฌ ีฟีกึีฅีฌ ีง ีคีกีทีฟีฅึีธึีด ีฃีฟีถีพีธีฒ ีดีกีถึ ีฅีฒีปีฅึีกีพีธึ ีกีถีกีฝีธึีถีถีฅึีซีถ: ิฑีถีฑึึีซ ีฐีฅีฟึีกีถึีธีพ ีพีถีกีฝีพีฅีฌ ีฅีถ ีถีกึ ีฟีถีฅึีซ ีฟีกีถีซึีถีฅึีจ ึ ีกีถีกีฝีถีกีฃีธีดีฅึีจ: ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีถ ีกีตึีฅีฌีฅีฌ ีง ีฃีตีธึีฒ ึ ีฌีฝีฅีฌ ีฃีตีธึีฒีกึีซีถีฅึีซ ีดีฟีกีฐีธีฃีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีจ, ีฎีกีถีธีฉีกึีฅีฌ ีขีถีกีฏีกีถ ีกีฒีฅีฟีซ ีฐีฅีฟึีกีถึีถีฅึีซีถ:

entry.title: 24 Years of Armenia: Life Through The Lens of an American Photographer

media:group.media:title: 24 Years of Armenia: Life Through The Lens of an American Photographer
media:group.media:description:
Join CivilNet as we explore the stories behind photos from the "To My Armenia" exhibition by Winslow Martin. An American photojournalist, Martin first visited Armenia in 1999 to complete a newspaper story on an Armenian-American priest, Father Dajad Davidian. Since that first visit, Winslow continued to visit Armenia, capturing both large-scale events and everyday nuances. Spanning 24 years, his collection of 147 photos showcases his unique perspective as a self-proclaimed outsider-turned-insider. The exhibition can be found in the History Museum of Armenia in Republic Square until September 3.

media:group.media:description:
200 ึ ึีซึ ีกีพีฅีฌีซ ีทึีปีกึีกีฏีดีกีถ ีดีฅีป ีฃีฟีถีพีธีฒ ีกึึีกีญึีซีถีฅึีซีถ ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีจ ึีธึีฑีธึีด ีง ีณีถีทีฅีฌ ีถีกึ ีฆีฅีถึีซ ีธึีชีซ ีดีซีปีธึีธีพ: ีีฅึีปีซีถ ีทึีปีกีถีธึีด ีกีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีธีฒีดีจ ีฏึีกีฏีธึีด ีง ีธีน ีดีซีกีตีถ ีคีซึึีฅึีซ, ีกีตีฌึ ีฃีตีธึีฒีฅึีซ ีธึีฒีฒีธึีฉีตีกีดีข, ึ ึีซีถีกีฏ` ีฏึีกีฏีฅีฌ ีฅีถ ีีกีถีฏีกีฉีกีฒีซ ีขีถีกีฏีฅีฌีซ ีฟีถีฅึีซ ีธึีฒีฒีธึีฉีตีกีดีข, ีกีฏีกีถีกีถีฅีฟ ีฅีถ ีฏีซึีกีผีฅีฌ ิฟีซีนีกีถีซ ีธึ ีีธึ ีีกีฆีกีถีนีซีซ ีธึีฒีฒีธึีฉีตีกีดีข: ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีจ ีฅีฒีฅีฌ ีง ีกีตีค ีฃีตีธึีฒีฅึีธึีด ึ ีฆึีธึึีฅีฌ ีขีถีกีฏีซีนีถีฅึีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีกีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีกีฏีกีถ ีฝีกีคึีกีถึีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ:

ยฉ ีีตีธึีฉีซ ีฐีฅีฒีซีถีกีฏีกีตีซีถ ีซึีกีพีธึีถึีถีฅึีจ ีบีกีฟีฏีกีถีธึีด ีฅีถ ีีซีพีซีฌีซีฉีกีฝ ีฐีซีดีถีกีคึีกีดีซีถ: ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ีญีดีขีกีฃึีกีฏีกีถ ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีกีดีกีฑีกีตีถ` ีกึีฃีฅีฌีพีธึีด ีง ึ ีฃีฟีกีฃีธึีฎีฅีฌ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ีถีตีธึีฉีฅึีจ ีกีผีกีถึ ีบีกีฟีทีกีณ ีฐีฒีดีกีถ, ีถีฅึีขีฅีผีถีฅีฌ ึ ีกีตีฌ ึ ีถีฌีกีตีถ ีฐีกึีฉีกีฏีซึ ีพีฅึีขีฅีผีถีฅีฌ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ีบีกีฟึีกีฝีฟีกีฎ ึ ีฟีกึีขีฅึีกีถีทีกีถีจ ีฏึีธีฒ ีฟีฅีฝีกีถีตีธึีฉีฅึีจ` ีกีผีกีถึ ีฐีกีดีกีบีกีฟีกีฝีญีกีถ ีฐีกีดีกีฑีกีตีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ:
